summary: If Bran Stark isn't at Winterfell's Great Hall when Jaime Lannister arrives, looks him straight in the eyes and say "I lived,...
body: If Bran Stark isn’t at Winterfell’s Great Hall when Jaime Lannister arrives, looks him straight in the eyes and say “I lived, bitch” with the facial expression he kept during season 7 and makes Jaime super uncomfortable, then what’s the point of Season 8?

reblog.comment: If Bran Stark isn’t at Winterfell’s Great Hall when Jaime Lannister arrives, looks him straight in the eyes and say “I lived, bitch” with the facial expression he kept during season 7 and makes Jaime super uncomfortable, then what’s the point of Season 8?

summary: Bran meeting Jon and Dany at Winterfell
title: Bran meeting Jon and Dany at Winterfell
body:
Bran: You both looked beautiful that night on the boat.
Dany: I...uh-
Bran: Congratulations, btw. It's a girl. Caw caw. 
Jon: BRAN COULDN'T YOU HAVE JUST STOPPED?
Bran: You said "Don't look away" remember? 
Jon: ffs

summary: Bran stark in S8??
title: Bran stark in S8??
body:
Saw a theory about maybe the lines in stark promo of you have to protect him along with a feather being covered in ice was about Bran? Like they have to protect him from the night king or else they lose. I mean if the night king has bran he could warg into the dragons or see into enemy line?


Dunno if I am reading too much into this because D&D may just be assholes.

tags: put some respect on his name
summary: reminder
title: reminder
body: bran stark: *is a sweet,caring, gentle boy* *survives a terrible fall that paralyses his legs* *wakes up when most of his family is gone* *copes with his disability alone* *becomes lord of winterfell when robb is named king* *runs winterfell sufficiently with help from maester luwin* *befriends a wildling and earns her loyalty* *hands over winterfell to theon to avoid bloodshed* *watches people he’s known his entire life get murdered right in front him* *escapes winterfell with his brother and two adults* *travels north without getting caught* *realises the reed siblings are helpful in regards to his powers and tries to integrate them into the group* *helps save jon’s life* *makes the hard choice of separating from his little brother because he knows they’re going somewhere dangerous* *goes beyond the wall* *saves jon again* *finds the three eyed raven* *learns about his powers and he sees his father again* *makes a mistake because he wasn’t warned about it beforehand* *watches his mentor, the last of the children and hodor get killed* *absorbs more knowledge than humans can handle until it overwhelms him* *including all the terrible things that have happened to his family* *wants to save the world despite everything* *is the key to defeating the night king*

summary: I'm hoping Bran will get his own promo because he is both Stark and three eyed raven. I know they could have included him in...
question: I'm hoping Bran will get his own promo because he is both Stark and three eyed raven. I know they could have included him in this one with that concept, but here's to hoping! Can't wait for Dany's promo!
answer:
Hello,

Let’s hope so. It would be really awful for the show to ignore his importance especially as we get closer to the War for Dawn. They don’t need to hide it, we all know it, so give the young man his due. Perhaps we’’ll see something between him and the Night’s King. 

I hope they have a promo with Dany but I think we’ll just have to wait for the trailer to get more footage from her. They have been hiding her, but maybe it’s because she’ll have a really cool costume and they don’t want to spoil it (here’s hoping). 

TTFN

summary: Hi!! You probably have watched the new Stark promo by now. Isn't it wonderfull that Jon and Arya are finally reunited?? I just...
question: Hi!! You probably have watched the new Stark promo by now. Isn't it wonderfull that Jon and Arya are finally reunited?? I just wanted to talk to someone who loves them and their bond as much as I do :) Do you think we are going to see many scenes with those two? I hope that's the case because I've been waiting ages for their reunion. I want to see them fighting next to each other so badly!!! (also shame on D&D for disrespecting Bran like that).
answer:
Hello darling!! First of all thank you so much for this ask 😙😙

And to answer your question: IT’S ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL THAT JON AND ARYA HAVE FINALLY REUNITED!!!!

I got such a warm and gooey feeling in my heart while watching the teaser. It has been 9 years, hasn’t it? 9 years since we all saw them together. And my God! They were looking so amazing!

Also I do think we are going to have a considerable number of scenes where we are going to see Jon and Arya together. One of them is obviously going to be the much awaited reunion. I am hoping for it to be a private one. It just doesn’t feel right for it to be a public one, you know? It needs to be intimate. Two outcasts of Winterfell, finally meeting each other again.

AND I AM HOPING FOR THEM TO FIGHT SIDE BY SIDE TOO!! That’s the least D&d can do after exaggerating this particular point of Arya’s storyline. And let’s not forget that Arya has a Valyrian steel dagger now. So yeah I am sure we are going to get at least one scene of them fighting side by side.

Also Bran! My darling boy Bran!! You know it’s so disappointing that D&d continues to ignore him…it’s like as if for them, he doesn’t even matter anymore. They did him so bad the last season and right now they did it again by not including him in the teaser. AND THAT’S SO FOOLISH!!! I hope that we get at least one last teaser before the actual trailer of s8 is released. And I want that teaser to completely focus on Bran…cause in the show, he is the only one who is the Warg out of all the Stark kids. So that has to mean something, especially if the Night king is coming for them. Even D&d has to realise that!

Anyway this is getting way too gibberish but I really am so glad for this ask. I had to let it all out. So once again thank you so much!

summary: HBO confirma data de estreia da nova e última temporada de Game of Thrones
title: HBO confirma data de estreia da nova e última temporada de Game of Thrones
body:
Um novo post está em https://www.showmetech.com.br/hbo-confirma-data-de-estreia-da-nova-e-ultima-temporada-de-game-of-thrones/

HBO confirma data de estreia da nova e última temporada de Game of Thrones

Game of Thrones: O Inverno chegou, e será dia 14 de abril de 2019. Com ele, Daenerys Targaryen e Jon Snow desembarcam em Winterfell, aquilo que seria uma jornada ao encerramento de uma das séries mais populares da TV à Cabo.

Recorde de estatuetas Emmy e também a série mais assistida por meios ilegais, o carro-chefe da HBO orgulha-se de poder conciliar sucesso de crítica e sucesso de público. Tudo ao seu respeito é capaz de movimentar multidões e os muitos mistérios e, por que não, destino de seus personagens são fonte de angústia e curiosidade de seus fãs.

Com o vazamento online dos roteiros dos primeiros episódios da sétima temporada, para oitava e último, a HBO mostra que aprendeu a lição. Tudo está sendo guardado a sete-chaves. E por enquanto, está sendo bem sucedido. Mas por fim a espera acabou. Os Starks estão em Winterfell e uma guerra inevitável se aproxima. 

Game of Thrones: misterios por vir

Por fim, os fãs foram surpreendidos com um teaser pra lá de misterioso em que os personagens Jon Snow, Arya Stark e Sansa Stark caminham pelas já conhecidas criptas de sua terra natal a fim de escutar mensagens de seus familiares já falecidos: Ned Stark e Caitlyn Stark, assim como Lyanna Stark, irmã de Ned e também (spoiler!) mãe de Jon.

O grande plot twist é quando eles ficam frentea frente com suas próprias estátuas. Um indicativo de seu próprio fim? Isso, somado a ausência de um outro Stark, Bran torna tudo ainda mais misterioso. Uma ameaça gelada aproxima-se sorrateiramente, acuando os personagens, que estão prontos para revidar, ou morrer tentando.

Fãs estão esperando desde Agosto de 2017 a temporada final do show de fantasia, baseado na franquia bestseller Canção de Fogo e Gelo de George R.R Martin. Algumas dicas foram reveladas aqui e ali, incluindo que haverá seis episódios de longa duração e, quem sabe, filmes. Os primeiros atores para um tal spin-off começaram a ser confirmados. 

Showrunners David Benioff e D.B Weiss, assim como David Nutter e Miguel Sapochnik ficaram responsáveis pela direção desta temporada e Benioff, Weiss, Bryan Congman e Dave Hill estão responsáveis pelo roteiro.

É sabido que os caminhos seguidos pela série são independentes e diferentes do livro, já que não há nenhuma continuação lançada desde 2011. E tampouco há previsão de um fim. Pelo menos nos livros. A série, por outro lado, caminha para o seu inevitável fim, assim como alguns de nossos personagens favoritos.
